title: Mago II of Carthage
text:
MagoII, also known as Magon (, ), was <a href="Shofet">Shofet</a> of <a href="Carthage">Carthage</a> from 396 to 375 BCE, and was a member of the <a href="Magonid">Magonid</a> dynasty. He became Shofet after the suicide of <a href="Himilco%20II%20of%20Carthage">Himilco II</a> in 396 BCE and was succeeded by <a href="Mago%20III%20of%20Carthage">Mago III</a> (or Himilco Mago) in 375 BCE.
His reign started during wars with the Greeks of Sicily, who under the leadership of <a href="Dionysius%20I%20of%20Syracuse">Dionysius I of Syracuse</a> had defeated his predecessor. He quelled a rebellion in Libya, and made peace with Syracuse at the expense of his Sicilian allies the <a href="Sicel">Sicel</a>s.
War broke out again at the end of his reign and he died in the Carthaginian defeat of the <a href="Battle%20of%20Cabala">Battle of Cabala</a>, he was succeeded by his son, <a href="Mago%20III%20of%20Carthage">also called Mago</a> "Himilco Mago" who led the Carthaginians to a great victory against Dionysius at the <a href="battle%20of%20Cronium">battle of Cronium</a>.
